formElement.label: Ant Location:
formElement.documentation: The location of ant. If only "ant" is entered, ant executable must be loaded into the system path. i.e: /path/to/ant or ant

formElement.label: Build File:
formElement.documentation: The build file to use. Default is build.xml in the current directory.

formElement.label: Libraries:
formElement.documentation: Enter one library and/or directory per line or separate multiple libraries and/or directories with semicolons.

formElement.label: Properties:
formElement.documentation: Enter each property as key=value with multiple properties separated by semicolons.

formElement.label: Property File:
formElement.documentation: The path to a file containing properties.

formElement.label: Debug:
formElement.documentation: Enable extra debug information to be generated.

formElement.label: Diagnostics:
formElement.documentation: Enable diagnostics information to be generated.

formElement.label: Output Level:
formElement.documentation: Specify the level of verbosity that is generated and printed by Ant.

formElement.label: Log File:
formElement.documentation: Specify the file into which the log will be redirected.

formElement.label: Target:
formElement.documentation: Specify the ant targets to be executed. If targets are not specified, the default target from the selected build file will be used.

formElement.label: Postp Line:
formElement.documentation: Specify the postp command line to execute i.e. postp --loadProperty /myProject/postp_matchers. If this parameter is left blank the default postp matcher will be used.

formElement.label: Working Directory:
formElement.documentation: The directory from which ant should be invoked.

formElement.label: Environment Variables:
formElement.documentation: Set Environment variables (if required) using perl syntax. (e.g. $ENV{'JAVA_HOME'}="C:\cygwin\usr\local\tools\i686_win32\jdk1.6.0_30";)
